So sar as we are concerned, if you think it is right for you, since you are God’s Vicegerent on earth, that the obligations of asolemn treaty and peace should be violated, we ask you that, although you may be unwilling, we may be able to defend the Empire, partly acquired by our ancestors and partly by ourselveS, with due regard to the dignity of our Republic. With us nothing has been more highly valued than peace, which has always cherished and increased our liberty, no less than war; neither have our ancestors, nor have w'e ever entered upon a war, except in order that by that means we might lay the foundations of peace. Lately we have fought not with the desire of extending our rule, but for the defence of our liberty, with yourself for our leader and adviser; in which thing if you desert us, neglecting the obligation of the peace agreed upon between us, we do not see on what grounds you advise us to peace, who now by a seigned asseveration disturb the obligations of peace.
